member.summary: Gets or sets the Default value of the channel. If a channel has no keyframe sequences connected, the default value will be used during the animation evaluation. A real scenario: Animation only animates a node's x coordinate, the y and z are not changed, then the default value will be used during full translation evaluation.

member.summary:
Aspose.3D's supports animation hierarchy, each animation can be composed by several animations and animation's key-frame definition.
defines the transformation of a property value over time, for example, animation node can be used to control a node's transformation or other object's numerical properties.

member.summary: The value will remains constant to the value of the first point until the next segment.

member.summary: Linear interpolation is a straight line between two points.

member.summary: A bezier or hermite spline.

member.summary: Basis splines are defined by a series of control points, for which the curve is guaranteed only to go through the first and the last point.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.Interpolation.CardinalSpline
member.summary: A cardinal spline is a cubic hermite spline whose tangents are defined by the endpoints and a tension parameter.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.Interpolation.TCBSpline
member.summary: Also called Kochanek-Bartels spline, the behavior of tangent is defined by tension/bias/continuity

member.summary: Out(right) tangent is weighted.

member.summary: Next in(left) tangent is weighted.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.WeightedMode.Both

member.summary: Value will keep the same value of the last value

member.summary: The repetition.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Animation.KeyFrame
member.summary: A key frame is mainly defined by a time and a value, for some interpolation types, tangent/tension/bias/continuity is also used by calculating the final sampled value. Sampled values in a non-key-frame time position is interpolated by key-frames between the previous and next key-frames Value before/after the first/last key-frame are calculated by the class.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Entities.Light
member.summary:
The light illuminates the scene.
The formula to calculate the total attenuation of light is: A = ConstantAttenuation + (Dist * LinearAttenuation) + ((Dist^2) * QuadraticAttenuation)

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Entities.Geometry
member.summary:
The base class of all renderable geometric objects (like , , and etcs).
The base class supports:
Control point management, control points defines the base 3D spatial structure of the geometry, different geometric types has different way to define concrete 3D models.
Vertex element definition, vertex elements applies extra informations like normals/uv coordinates/vertex colors to the geometry, see for more details.
Object deforming, can be binded to animate geometry's shape.

member.summary: This node attribute contains methods for accessing the properties of a stereo camera. Generally, a set of stereoRig contains the center camera, the left camera and the right camera. CameraStereo is used to represent the center camera. The left and right camera could be Camera. CameraStereo contains stereo properties. The left and right camera can also be get and set via related methods in CameraStereo class.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Entities.CameraSwitcher
member.summary: This node attribute contains methods for accessing the properties of a camera switcher. The camera switcher is a concept of Motion Builder. The camera switcher lets you switch between the custom cameras placed in your scene so you can create an animation using multiple camera angles. Custom cameras are cameras which created by users, while the default cameras are top, bottom, left, right, front, back and perspective camera. The Camera switcher contains the custom cameras you have created. If you have no custom cameras created in your scene, the Camera switcher is empty. Please read Motion Builder documentation for more details.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Entities.LODGroup
member.summary: Defines a LOD (Level of Detail) group. This LodGroup node is a group node that can be used to detect how close a group of objects is to a camera. Typically this node is used for controlling "Level of Detail" visibility. Properties in the class are designed according to Maya implementation. So these properties may be incompatible with other software, like 3ds Max. In Maya, with "Level of Detail",the visibility of the children of this transform are controlled by the distance of a group to a camera and the threshold values. For example, under a LOD group node, there are three children: ship_detailed, ship_medium, and ship_rough. There are three threshold values: 5, 10 and 15. When the camera is within 5 units of the group bounding box, only ship_detailed is visible. When the view is zoomed out and the camera is 9 units away from the group, only ship_medium is visible. When the view is zoomed out to 30 units away, only ship_rough is visible. This node attribute contains the properties of a null node.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Entities.LODGroup.MinMaxDistance
member.summary: This property handles the use of the Min/Max distances.

member.summary: The minimum distance at which the group is displayed.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Entities.LODGroup.MaxDistance
member.summary: The maximum distance at which the group is displayed.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Entities.LODGroup.WorldSpace
member.summary: Work in world space of transform or local space If true, the camera distance to the LOD group will be computed in world space.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFTechnique
member.summary: A template for material appearances.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFTechnique.TFParameters
member.summary: An attribute or uniform input to a technique, and an optional semantic and value.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFTechnique.TFParameters.Count
member.summary: When defined, the parameter is an array of count elements of the specified type. Otherwise, the parameter is not an array. When defined, `value` is an array with length equal to count, times the number of components in the type, e.g., `3` for `FLOAT_VEC3`. An array parameter of scalar values is not the same as a vector parameter of the same size; for example, when count is 2 and type is 5126 (FLOAT), the parameter is an array of two floating-point values, not a FLOAT_VEC2.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFTechnique.TFParameters.Node
member.summary: The id of the node whose transform is used as the parameter's value. When this is defined, `type` must be `35676` (FLOAT_MAT4), therefore, when the semantic is "MODELINVERSETRANSPOSE", "MODELVIEWINVERSETRANSPOSE", or "VIEWPORT", the node property can't be defined.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFTechnique.TFParameters.Semantic
member.summary: Identifies a parameter with a well-known meaning. Uniform semantics include `"LOCAL"` (FLOAT_MAT4), `"MODEL"` (FLOAT_MAT4), `"VIEW"` (FLOAT_MAT4), `"PROJECTION"` (FLOAT_MAT4), `"MODELVIEW"` (FLOAT_MAT4), `"MODELVIEWPROJECTION"` (FLOAT_MAT4), `"MODELINVERSE"` (FLOAT_MAT4), `"VIEWINVERSE"` (FLOAT_MAT4), `"PROJECTIONINVERSE"` (FLOAT_MAT4), `"MODELVIEWINVERSE"` (FLOAT_MAT4), `"MODELVIEWPROJECTIONINVERSE"` (FLOAT_MAT4), `"MODELINVERSETRANSPOSE"` (FLOAT_MAT3), `"MODELVIEWINVERSETRANSPOSE"` (FLOAT_MAT3), `"VIEWPORT"` (FLOAT_VEC4), `"JOINTMATRIX"` (FLOAT_MAT4). Attribute semantics include `"POSITION"`, `"NORMAL"`, `"TEXCOORD"`, `"COLOR"`, `"JOINT"`, and `"WEIGHT"`. Attribute semantic property names can be of the form `[semantic]_[set_index]`, e.g., `"TEXCOORD_0"`.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFTechnique.TFParameters.Type
member.summary: The datatype. All valid values correspond to WebGL enums.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFTechnique.TFParameters.Value
member.summary: The value of the parameter. A material value with the same name, when specified, overrides this value.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAccessor
member.summary: A typed view into a bufferView. A bufferView contains raw binary data. An accessor provides a typed view into a bufferView or a subset of a bufferView similar to how WebGL's `vertexAttribPointer()` defines an attribute in a buffer.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAccessor.BufferView
member.summary: The ID of the bufferView.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAccessor.ByteOffset
member.summary: The offset relative to the start of the bufferView in bytes. This must be a multiple of the size of the data type.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAccessor.ByteStride
member.summary: The stride, in bytes, between attributes referenced by this accessor. When this is zero, the attributes are tightly packed.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAccessor.ComponentType
member.summary: The datatype of components in the attribute. All valid values correspond to WebGL enums. The corresponding typed arrays are `Int8Array`, `Uint8Array`, `Int16Array`, `Uint16Array`, and `Float32Array`, respectively.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAccessor.Count
member.summary: The number of attributes referenced by this accessor, not to be confused with the number of bytes or number of components.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAccessor.Max
member.summary: Maximum value of each component in this attribute. When both min and max arrays are defined, they have the same length. The length is determined by the value of the type property; it can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, or 16.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAccessor.Min
member.summary: Minimum value of each component in this attribute. When both min and max arrays are defined, they have the same length. The length is determined by the value of the type property; it can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, or 16.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAccessor.Type
member.summary: Specifies if the attribute is a scalar, vector, or matrix, and the number of elements in the vector or matrix.

member.summary: The ID of the technique. If this is not supplied, and no extension is present that defines material properties, then the primitive should be rendered using a default material with 50% gray emissive color.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFMaterial.Values
member.summary: A dictionary object of parameter values. Parameters with the same name as the technique's parameter override the technique's parameter value.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFNode
member.summary: A node in the node hierarchy. A node can have either the `camera`, `meshes`, or `skeletons`/`skin`/`meshes` properties defined. In the later case, all `primitives` in the referenced `meshes` contain `JOINT` and `WEIGHT` attributes and the referenced `material`/`technique` from each `primitive` has parameters with `JOINT` and `WEIGHT` semantics. A node can have either a `matrix` or any combination of `translation`/`rotation`/`scale` (TRS) properties. TRS properties are converted to matrices and postmultiplied in the `T * R * S` order to compose the transformation matrix; first the scale is applied to the vertices, then the rotation, and then the translation. If none are provided, the transform is the identity. When a node is targeted for animation (referenced by an animation.channel.target), only TRS properties may be present; `matrix` will not be present.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFNode.TFKHR_materials_common
member.summary: KHR_materials_common node extension

member.summary: The node's unit quaternion rotation in the order (x, y, z, w), where w is the scalar.

member.summary: A dictionary object of bufferViews. The name of each bufferView is an ID in the global glTF namespace that is used to reference the bufferView. A bufferView is a view into a buffer generally representing a subset of the buffer.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.Buffers
member.summary: A dictionary object of buffers. The name of each buffer is an ID in the global glTF namespace that is used to reference the buffer. A buffer points to binary geometry, animation, or skins.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.Cameras
member.summary: A dictionary object of cameras. The name of each camera is an ID in the global glTF namespace that is used to reference the camera. A camera defines a projection matrix.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.ExtensionsUsed
member.summary: Names of extensions used somewhere in this asset.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.Images
member.summary: A dictionary object of images. The name of each image is an ID in the global glTF namespace that is used to reference the image. An image defines data used to create a texture.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.Materials
member.summary: A dictionary object of materials. The name of each material is an ID in the global glTF namespace that is used to reference the material. A material defines the appearance of a primitive.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.Meshes
member.summary: A dictionary object of meshes. The name of each mesh is an ID in the global glTF namespace that is used to reference the mesh. A mesh is a set of primitives to be rendered.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.Nodes
member.summary: A dictionary object of nodes in the node hierarchy. The name of each node is an ID in the global glTF namespace that is used to reference the node.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.Programs
member.summary: A dictionary object of shader programs. The name of each program is an ID in the global glTF namespace that is used to reference the program.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.Samplers
member.summary: A dictionary object of samplers. The name of each sampler is an ID in the global glTF namespace that is used to reference the sampler. A sampler contains properties for texture filtering and wrapping modes.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.SceneId
member.summary: The ID of the default scene.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.Scenes
member.summary: A dictionary object of scenes. The name of each scene is an ID in the global glTF namespace that is used to reference the scene.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.Shaders
member.summary: A dictionary object of shaders. The name of each shader is an ID in the global glTF namespace that is used to reference the shader.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.Skins
member.summary: A dictionary object of skins. The name of each skin is an ID in the global glTF namespace that is used to reference the skin. A skin is defined by joints and matrices.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.Techniques
member.summary: A dictionary object of techniques. The name of each technique is an ID in the global glTF namespace that is used to reference the technique. A technique is a template for a material appearance.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFGlTF.Textures
member.summary: A dictionary object of textures. The name of each texture is an ID in the global glTF namespace that is used to reference the texture.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAnimation
member.summary: A keyframe animation.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAnimation.TFChannel
member.summary: Targets an animation's sampler at a node's property.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAnimation.TFChannel.TFTarget
member.summary: The ID of the node and TRS property that an animation channel targets.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAnimation.TFChannel.TFTarget.Id
member.summary: The ID of the node to target.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAnimation.TFChannel.TFTarget.Path
member.summary: The name of the node's TRS property to modify.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAnimation.TFChannel.Sampler
member.summary: The ID of a sampler in this animation used to compute the value for the target, e.g., a node's translation, rotation, or scale (TRS).

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAnimation.TFChannel.Target
member.summary: The ID of the node and TRS property to target.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAnimation.TFSampler
member.summary: Combines input and output parameters with an interpolation algorithm to define a keyframe graph (but not its target).

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAnimation.TFSampler.Input
member.summary: The ID of a parameter in this animation to use as keyframe input. This parameter must have type `FLOAT`. The values represent time in seconds with `time[0] >= 0.0`, and monotonically increasing values, i.e., `time[n + 1] >= time[n]`.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAnimation.TFSampler.Interpolation
member.summary: Interpolation algorithm. When an animation targets a node's rotation, and the animation's interpolation is `"LINEAR"`, spherical linear interpolation (slerp) should be used to interpolate quaternions.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAnimation.TFSampler.Output
member.summary: The ID of a parameter in this animation to use as keyframe output.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAnimation.Channels
member.summary: An array of channels, each of which targets an animation's sampler at a node's property.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAnimation.Parameters
member.summary: A dictionary object of strings whose values are IDs of accessors with keyframe data, e.g., time, translation, rotation, etc.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAnimation.Samplers
member.summary: A dictionary object of samplers that combines input and output parameters with an interpolation algorithm to define a keyframe graph (but not its target).

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFAsset
member.summary: Metadata about the glTF asset.

member.summary: Specifies the target rendering API.

member.summary: The API version.

member.summary: Specifies if the shaders were generated with premultiplied alpha.

member.summary: The glTF version.

member.summary: A camera's projection. A node can reference a camera ID to apply a transform to place the camera in the scene.

member.summary: An orthographic camera containing properties to create an orthographic projection matrix.

member.summary: The floating-point horizontal magnification of the view.

member.summary: The floating-point vertical magnification of the view.

member.summary: The floating-point distance to the far clipping plane.

member.summary: The floating-point distance to the near clipping plane.

member.summary: A perspective camera containing properties to create a perspective projection matrix.

member.summary: The floating-point aspect ratio of the field of view. When this is undefined, the aspect ratio of the canvas is used.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFCamera.TFPerspective.Yfov
member.summary: The floating-point vertical field of view in radians.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFCamera.TFPerspective.Zfar
member.summary: The floating-point distance to the far clipping plane. zfar must be greater than znear.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFCamera.TFPerspective.Znear
member.summary: The floating-point distance to the near clipping plane. zfar must be greater than znear.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFCamera.Orthographic
member.summary: An orthographic camera containing properties to create an orthographic projection matrix.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFCamera.Perspective
member.summary: A perspective camera containing properties to create a perspective projection matrix.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFCamera.Type
member.summary: Specifies if the camera uses a perspective or orthographic projection. Based on this, either the camera's `perspective` or `orthographic` property will be defined.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFMesh
member.summary: A set of primitives to be rendered. A node can contain one or more meshes. A node's transform places the mesh in the scene.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFMesh.TFPrimitive
member.summary: Geometry to be rendered with the given material.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFMesh.TFPrimitive.Attributes
member.summary: A dictionary object of strings, where each string is the ID of the accessor containing an attribute.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFMesh.TFPrimitive.Indices
member.summary: The ID of the accessor that contains the indices. When this is not defined, the primitives should be rendered without indices using `drawArrays()`. When defined, the accessor must contain indices: the bufferView referenced by the accessor must have a target equal to 34963 (ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER); a byteStride that is tightly packed, i.e., 0 or the byte size of componentType in bytes; componentType must be 5121 (UNSIGNED_BYTE) or 5123 (UNSIGNED_SHORT); and type must be "SCALAR".

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFMesh.TFPrimitive.Material
member.summary: The ID of the material to apply to this primitive when rendering.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFMesh.TFPrimitive.Mode
member.summary: The type of primitives to render. All valid values correspond to WebGL enums.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFMesh.Primitives
member.summary: An array of primitives, each defining geometry to be rendered with a material.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFProgram
member.summary: A shader program, including its vertex and fragment shader, and names of vertex shader attributes.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFProgram.Attributes
member.summary: Names of GLSL vertex shader attributes.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFProgram.FragmentShader
member.summary: The ID of the fragment shader.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFProgram.VertexShader
member.summary: The ID of the vertex shader.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFSampler
member.summary: Texture sampler properties for filtering and wrapping modes.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFSampler.MagFilter
member.summary: Magnification filter. Valid values correspond to WebGL enums: `9728` (NEAREST) and `9729` (LINEAR).

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFSampler.MinFilter
member.summary: Minification filter. All valid values correspond to WebGL enums.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFSampler.WrapS
member.summary: s wrapping mode. All valid values correspond to WebGL enums.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFSampler.WrapT
member.summary: t wrapping mode. All valid values correspond to WebGL enums.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFScene
member.summary: The root nodes of a scene.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFScene.Nodes
member.summary: The IDs of each root node.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFSkin
member.summary: Joints and matrices defining a skin.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFSkin.BindShapeMatrix
member.summary: Floating-point 4x4 transformation matrix stored in column-major order.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFSkin.InverseBindMatrices
member.summary: The ID of the accessor containing the floating-point 4x4 inverse-bind matrices.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFSkin.JointNames
member.summary: Joint names of the joints (nodes with a `jointName` property) in this skin. The array length is the same as the `count` property of the `inverseBindMatrices` accessor, and the same as the total quantity of all skeleton nodes from node-trees referenced by the skinned mesh instance node's `skeletons` array.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFTexture
member.summary: A texture and its sampler.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFTexture.Format
member.summary: The texture's format. Valid values correspond to WebGL enums: `6406` (ALPHA), `6407` (RGB), `6408` (RGBA), `6409` (LUMINANCE), and `6410` (LUMINANCE_ALPHA).

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFTexture.InternalFormat
member.summary: The texture's internal format. Valid values correspond to WebGL enums: `6406` (ALPHA), `6407` (RGB), `6408` (RGBA), `6409` (LUMINANCE), and `6410` (LUMINANCE_ALPHA). Defaults to same value as format.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFTexture.Sampler
member.summary: The ID of the sampler used by this texture.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFTexture.Source
member.summary: The ID of the image used by this texture.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFTexture.Target
member.summary: The target that the WebGL texture should be bound to. Valid values correspond to WebGL enums: `3553` (TEXTURE_2D).

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v1.TFTexture.Type
member.summary: Texel datatype. Valid values correspond to WebGL enums: `5121` (UNSIGNED_BYTE), `33635` (UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5), `32819` (UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4), and `32820` (UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1).

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor
member.summary: A typed view into a bufferView. A bufferView contains raw binary data. An accessor provides a typed view into a bufferView or a subset of a bufferView similar to how WebGL's `vertexAttribPointer()` defines an attribute in a buffer.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.TFSparse
member.summary: Sparse storage of attributes that deviate from their initialization value.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.TFSparse.TFIndices
member.summary: Indices of those attributes that deviate from their initialization value.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.TFSparse.TFIndices.BufferView
member.summary: The index of the bufferView with sparse indices. Referenced bufferView can't have ARRAY_BUFFER or ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER target.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.TFSparse.TFIndices.ByteOffset
member.summary: The offset relative to the start of the bufferView in bytes. Must be aligned.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.TFSparse.TFIndices.ComponentType
member.summary: The indices data type. Valid values correspond to WebGL enums: `5121` (UNSIGNED_BYTE), `5123` (UNSIGNED_SHORT), `5125` (UNSIGNED_INT).

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.TFSparse.TFValues
member.summary: Array of size `accessor.sparse.count` times number of components storing the displaced accessor attributes pointed by `accessor.sparse.indices`.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.TFSparse.TFValues.BufferView
member.summary: The index of the bufferView with sparse values. Referenced bufferView can't have ARRAY_BUFFER or ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER target.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.TFSparse.TFValues.ByteOffset
member.summary: The offset relative to the start of the bufferView in bytes. Must be aligned.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.TFSparse.Count
member.summary: The number of attributes encoded in this sparse accessor.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.TFSparse.Indices
member.summary: Index array of size `count` that points to those accessor attributes that deviate from their initialization value. Indices must strictly increase.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.TFSparse.Values
member.summary: Array of size `count` times number of components, storing the displaced accessor attributes pointed by `indices`. Substituted values must have the same `componentType` and number of components as the base accessor.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.BufferView
member.summary: The index of the bufferView.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.ByteOffset
member.summary: The offset relative to the start of the bufferView in bytes. This must be a multiple of the size of the component datatype.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.ComponentType
member.summary: The datatype of components in the attribute. All valid values correspond to WebGL enums. The corresponding typed arrays are `Int8Array`, `Uint8Array`, `Int16Array`, `Uint16Array`, `Uint32Array`, and `Float32Array`, respectively. 5125 (UNSIGNED_INT) is only allowed when the accessor contains indices, i.e., the accessor is only referenced by `primitive.indices`.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.Count
member.summary: The number of attributes referenced by this accessor, not to be confused with the number of bytes or number of components.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.Max
member.summary:
Maximum value of each component in this attribute. Both min and max arrays have the same length. The length is determined by the value of the type property; it can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, or 16.
When `componentType` is `5126` (FLOAT) each array value must be stored as double-precision JSON number with numerical value which is equal to buffer-stored single-precision value to avoid extra runtime conversions.
`normalized` property has no effect on array values: they always correspond to the actual values stored in the buffer. When accessor is sparse, this property must contain max values of accessor data with sparse substitution applied.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.Min
member.summary:
Minimum value of each component in this attribute. Both min and max arrays have the same length. The length is determined by the value of the type property; it can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, or 16.
When `componentType` is `5126` (FLOAT) each array value must be stored as double-precision JSON number with numerical value which is equal to buffer-stored single-precision value to avoid extra runtime conversions.
`normalized` property has no effect on array values: they always correspond to the actual values stored in the buffer. When accessor is sparse, this property must contain min values of accessor data with sparse substitution applied.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.Normalized
member.summary: Specifies whether integer data values should be normalized (`true`) to [0, 1] (for unsigned types) or [-1, 1] (for signed types), or converted directly (`false`) when they are accessed. This property is defined only for accessors that contain vertex attributes or morph weights animation data.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.Sparse
member.summary: Sparse storage of attributes that deviate from their initialization value.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAccessor.Type
member.summary: Specifies if the attribute is a scalar, vector, or matrix.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAnimation
member.summary: A keyframe animation.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAnimation.TFChannel
member.summary: Targets an animation's sampler at a node's property.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAnimation.TFChannel.TFTarget
member.summary: The index of the node and TRS property that an animation channel targets.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAnimation.TFChannel.TFTarget.Node
member.summary: The index of the node to target.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAnimation.TFChannel.TFTarget.Path
member.summary: The name of the node's TRS property to modify, or the "weights" of the Morph Targets it instantiates.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAnimation.TFChannel.Sampler
member.summary: The index of a sampler in this animation used to compute the value for the target, e.g., a node's translation, rotation, or scale (TRS).

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAnimation.TFChannel.Target
member.summary: The index of the node and TRS property to target.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAnimation.TFSampler
member.summary: Combines input and output accessors with an interpolation algorithm to define a keyframe graph (but not its target).

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAnimation.TFSampler.Input
member.summary: The index of an accessor containing keyframe input values, e.g., time. That accessor must have componentType `FLOAT`. The values represent time in seconds with `time[0] >= 0.0`, and strictly increasing values, i.e., `time[n + 1] > time[n]`.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAnimation.TFSampler.Interpolation
member.summary: Interpolation algorithm.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAnimation.TFSampler.Output
member.summary: The index of an accessor, containing keyframe output values. When sampler is used with TRS target, output accessor's componentType must be `FLOAT`, output and input accessors must have the same `count` except for `CUBICSPLINE` interpolation where output count is 3x the input count. When sampler is used with morph weights target, output accessor's componentType can be `FLOAT` or normalized integer, output count must be the input count times the number of morph targets.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAnimation.Channels
member.summary: An array of channels, each of which targets an animation's sampler at a node's property. Different channels of the same animation can't have equal targets.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFAnimation.Samplers
member.summary: An array of samplers that combines input and output accessors with an interpolation algorithm to define a keyframe graph (but not its target).

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFCamera.TFPerspective.AspectRatio
member.summary: The floating-point aspect ratio of the field of view. When this is undefined, the aspect ratio of the canvas is used.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFCamera.TFPerspective.Yfov
member.summary: The floating-point vertical field of view in radians.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFCamera.TFPerspective.Zfar
member.summary: The floating-point distance to the far clipping plane. When defined, `zfar` must be greater than `znear`. If `zfar` is undefined, runtime must use infinite projection matrix.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFCamera.TFPerspective.Znear
member.summary: The floating-point distance to the near clipping plane.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFCamera.Orthographic
member.summary: An orthographic camera containing properties to create an orthographic projection matrix.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFCamera.Perspective
member.summary: A perspective camera containing properties to create a perspective projection matrix.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFCamera.Type
member.summary: Specifies if the camera uses a perspective or orthographic projection. Based on this, either the camera's `perspective` or `orthographic` property will be defined.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFGlTF
member.summary: The root object for a glTF asset.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFGlTF.TFKHR_materials_common
member.summary: KHR_materials_common glTF extension

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFGlTF.TFKHR_materials_pbrSpecularGlossiness
member.summary: glTF extension that defines the specular-glossiness material model from Physically-Based Rendering (PBR) methodology.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFGlTF.TFKHR_materials_pbrSpecularGlossiness.DiffuseFactor
member.summary: The RGBA components of the reflected diffuse color of the material. Metals have a diffuse value of `[0.0, 0.0, 0.0]`. The fourth component (A) is the alpha coverage of the material. The `alphaMode` property specifies how alpha is interpreted. The values are linear.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFGlTF.TFKHR_materials_pbrSpecularGlossiness.DiffuseTexture
member.summary: The diffuse texture. This texture contains RGB(A) components of the reflected diffuse color of the material in sRGB color space. If the fourth component (A) is present, it represents the alpha coverage of the material. Otherwise, an alpha of 1.0 is assumed. The `alphaMode` property specifies how alpha is interpreted. The stored texels must not be premultiplied.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFGlTF.TFKHR_materials_pbrSpecularGlossiness.GlossinessFactor
member.summary: The glossiness or smoothness of the material. A value of 1.0 means the material has full glossiness or is perfectly smooth. A value of 0.0 means the material has no glossiness or is completely rough. This value is linear.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFGlTF.TFKHR_materials_pbrSpecularGlossiness.SpecularFactor
member.summary: The specular RGB color of the material. This value is linear.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFGlTF.TFKHR_materials_pbrSpecularGlossiness.SpecularGlossinessTexture
member.summary: The specular-glossiness texture is RGBA texture, containing the specular color of the material (RGB components) and its glossiness (A component). The values are in sRGB space.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFGlTF.Accessors
member.summary: An array of accessors. An accessor is a typed view into a bufferView.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFGlTF.Animations
member.summary: An array of keyframe animations.

member.summary: Metadata about the glTF asset.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFGlTF.BufferViews
member.summary: An array of bufferViews. A bufferView is a view into a buffer generally representing a subset of the buffer.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFGlTF.Buffers

member.summary: An array of cameras. A camera defines a projection matrix.

member.summary: Names of glTF extensions used somewhere in this asset.

member.summary: An array of images. An image defines data used to create a texture.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial
member.summary: The material appearance of a primitive.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.TFNormalTextureInfo
member.summary: normalTextureInfo

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.TFNormalTextureInfo.Scale
member.summary: The scalar multiplier applied to each normal vector of the texture. This value scales the normal vector using the formula: `scaledNormal = normalize((normalize(<sampled normal texture value>) * 2.0 - 1.0) * vec3(<normal scale>, <normal scale>, 1.0))`. This value is ignored if normalTexture is not specified. This value is linear.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.TFOcclusionTextureInfo
member.summary: occlusionTextureInfo

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.TFOcclusionTextureInfo.Strength
member.summary: A scalar multiplier controlling the amount of occlusion applied. A value of 0.0 means no occlusion. A value of 1.0 means full occlusion. This value affects the resulting color using the formula: `occludedColor = lerp(color, color * <sampled occlusion texture value>, <occlusion strength>)`. This value is ignored if the corresponding texture is not specified. This value is linear.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.TFPbrMetallicRoughness
member.summary: A set of parameter values that are used to define the metallic-roughness material model from Physically-Based Rendering (PBR) methodology.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.TFPbrMetallicRoughness.BaseColorFactor
member.summary: The RGBA components of the base color of the material. The fourth component (A) is the alpha coverage of the material. The `alphaMode` property specifies how alpha is interpreted. These values are linear. If a baseColorTexture is specified, this value is multiplied with the texel values.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.TFPbrMetallicRoughness.BaseColorTexture
member.summary: The base color texture. This texture contains RGB(A) components in sRGB color space. The first three components (RGB) specify the base color of the material. If the fourth component (A) is present, it represents the alpha coverage of the material. Otherwise, an alpha of 1.0 is assumed. The `alphaMode` property specifies how alpha is interpreted. The stored texels must not be premultiplied.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.TFPbrMetallicRoughness.MetallicFactor
member.summary: The metalness of the material. A value of 1.0 means the material is a metal. A value of 0.0 means the material is a dielectric. Values in between are for blending between metals and dielectrics such as dirty metallic surfaces. This value is linear. If a metallicRoughnessTexture is specified, this value is multiplied with the metallic texel values.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.TFPbrMetallicRoughness.MetallicRoughnessTexture
member.summary: The metallic-roughness texture. The metalness values are sampled from the B channel. The roughness values are sampled from the G channel. These values are linear. If other channels are present (R or A), they are ignored for metallic-roughness calculations.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.TFPbrMetallicRoughness.RoughnessFactor
member.summary: The roughness of the material. A value of 1.0 means the material is completely rough. A value of 0.0 means the material is completely smooth. This value is linear. If a metallicRoughnessTexture is specified, this value is multiplied with the roughness texel values.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.AlphaCutoff
member.summary: Specifies the cutoff threshold when in `MASK` mode. If the alpha value is greater than or equal to this value then it is rendered as fully opaque, otherwise, it is rendered as fully transparent. A value greater than 1.0 will render the entire material as fully transparent. This value is ignored for other modes.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.AlphaMode
member.summary: The material's alpha rendering mode enumeration specifying the interpretation of the alpha value of the main factor and texture.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.DoubleSided
member.summary: Specifies whether the material is double sided. When this value is false, back-face culling is enabled. When this value is true, back-face culling is disabled and double sided lighting is enabled. The back-face must have its normals reversed before the lighting equation is evaluated.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.EmissiveFactor
member.summary: The RGB components of the emissive color of the material. These values are linear. If an emissiveTexture is specified, this value is multiplied with the texel values.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.EmissiveTexture
member.summary: The emissive map controls the color and intensity of the light being emitted by the material. This texture contains RGB components in sRGB color space. If a fourth component (A) is present, it is ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.NormalTexture
member.summary: A tangent space normal map. The texture contains RGB components in linear space. Each texel represents the XYZ components of a normal vector in tangent space. Red [0 to 255] maps to X [-1 to 1]. Green [0 to 255] maps to Y [-1 to 1]. Blue [128 to 255] maps to Z [1/255 to 1]. The normal vectors use OpenGL conventions where +X is right and +Y is up. +Z points toward the viewer.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.OcclusionTexture
member.summary: The occlusion map texture. The occlusion values are sampled from the R channel. Higher values indicate areas that should receive full indirect lighting and lower values indicate no indirect lighting. These values are linear. If other channels are present (GBA), they are ignored for occlusion calculations.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMaterial.PbrMetallicRoughness
member.summary: A set of parameter values that are used to define the metallic-roughness material model from Physically-Based Rendering (PBR) methodology. When not specified, all the default values of `pbrMetallicRoughness` apply.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMesh
member.summary: A set of primitives to be rendered. A node can contain one mesh. A node's transform places the mesh in the scene.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMesh.TFPrimitive
member.summary: Geometry to be rendered with the given material.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMesh.TFPrimitive.Attributes
member.summary: A dictionary object, where each key corresponds to mesh attribute semantic and each value is the index of the accessor containing attribute's data.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMesh.TFPrimitive.Indices
member.summary: The index of the accessor that contains mesh indices. When this is not defined, the primitives should be rendered without indices using `drawArrays()`. When defined, the accessor must contain indices: the `bufferView` referenced by the accessor should have a `target` equal to 34963 (ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER); `componentType` must be 5121 (UNSIGNED_BYTE), 5123 (UNSIGNED_SHORT) or 5125 (UNSIGNED_INT), the latter may require enabling additional hardware support; `type` must be `"SCALAR"`. For triangle primitives, the front face has a counter-clockwise (CCW) winding order.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMesh.TFPrimitive.Material
member.summary: The index of the material to apply to this primitive when rendering.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMesh.TFPrimitive.Mode
member.summary: The type of primitives to render. All valid values correspond to WebGL enums.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMesh.TFPrimitive.Targets
member.summary: An array of Morph Targets, each Morph Target is a dictionary mapping attributes (only `POSITION`, `NORMAL`, and `TANGENT` supported) to their deviations in the Morph Target.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMesh.Primitives
member.summary: An array of primitives, each defining geometry to be rendered with a material.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFMesh.Weights
member.summary: Array of weights to be applied to the Morph Targets.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFNode
member.summary: A node in the node hierarchy. When the node contains `skin`, all `mesh.primitives` must contain `JOINTS_0` and `WEIGHTS_0` attributes. A node can have either a `matrix` or any combination of `translation`/`rotation`/`scale` (TRS) properties. TRS properties are converted to matrices and postmultiplied in the `T * R * S` order to compose the transformation matrix; first the scale is applied to the vertices, then the rotation, and then the translation. If none are provided, the transform is the identity. When a node is targeted for animation (referenced by an animation.channel.target), only TRS properties may be present; `matrix` will not be present.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFNode.TFKHR_materials_common
member.summary: KHR_materials_common node extension

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFNode.TFKHR_materials_common.Light
member.summary: The id of the light referenced by this node.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFNode.Camera
member.summary: The index of the camera referenced by this node.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFNode.Children
member.summary: The indices of this node's children.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFNode.Matrix
member.summary: A floating-point 4x4 transformation matrix stored in column-major order.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFNode.Mesh
member.summary: The index of the mesh in this node.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFNode.Rotation
member.summary: The node's unit quaternion rotation in the order (x, y, z, w), where w is the scalar.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFNode.Scale
member.summary: The node's non-uniform scale.

member.summary: The index of the skin referenced by this node.

member.summary: The node's translation.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.GLTF.v2.TFNode.Weights
member.summary: The weights of the instantiated Morph Target. Number of elements must match number of Morph Targets of used mesh.

member.summary: Computes a "compression context" from 0 to 7 inclusive for faces on vertex iVtx. The context is based on the vertex's valence, and the total _known_ degree of already-coded faces on the vertex at the time of the call.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.SiemensJT.Codec.MeshCodec
member.summary:
This class serves as the abstract base class from which two concrete classes are derived to implement the core operations for a polygonal mesh coder or decoder. An instance of this object is used by the MeshCoderDriver to encode and decode polygonal meshes.
This class makes extensive use of DualVFMesh objects as the primary source and destination mesh topology storage data structures. This mediating data structure is necessary because the mesh coding scheme is deeply cooperative with and dependent upon such a vertex-facet data structure. Please refer to DualVFMesh for more information. Version 9.5 Rev-C Page 346

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.SiemensJT.Codec.MeshCodec.Run
member.summary: Runs the mesh encoder/decoder machine

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.SiemensJT.Codec.MeshCodec.RunComponent
member.summary: Decodes one "connected component" (contiguous group of polygons) into _pDstVFM. Because the polygonal model may be formed of multiple disconnected mesh components, it may be necessary for run() to call this method multiple times. This method returns obFoundComponent = True if it actually encoded a new mesh component, and obFoundComponent = False if it did not.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.SiemensJT.Codec.MeshCodec.InitNewComponent
member.summary: Locates an unencoded vertex and begins the encoding process for the newly-found mesh component.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.SiemensJT.Codec.MeshCodec.CompleteF(System.Int32)
member.summary: Completes the VFMesh face face on _pDstVFM by calling activateV() and completeV() for each as-yet inactive incident vertexes in the face's degree ring.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.SiemensJT.Codec.MeshCodec.ActivateF(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: "Activates" the VFMesh face, on _pDstVFM, at face face vertex slot iVSlot by calling ioFace() to obtain a new vertex number and hooking it up to the topological structure. If the face is a SPLIT face, then call ioSplitFace() and ioSplitPos() to get the information necessary to connect to an already-active face. Note that we use the term "activate" here to mean "read" for mesh decoding.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.SiemensJT.Codec.MeshCodec.ActivateV(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: "Activates" the VFMesh vertex, on _pDstVFM, at face face vertex slot iVSlot by calling ioFace() to obtain a new face number and hooking it up to the topological structure. Note that we use the term "activate" here to mean "read" for mesh decoding.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.SiemensJT.Codec.MeshCodec.CompleteV(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Completes the vertex vertex on _pDstVFM by activating all inactive faces incident upon it. As an optimization, the user must also pass in iVSlot which is the vertex slot on face 0 of vertex where vertex is located. This method begins its examination of vertex's faces at face 0 by working its way around the vertex in both CCW and CW directions, checking to see if there are any faces that can be hooked into vertex without calling activateF(). This can happen when a face is completed by a nearby vertex before coming here. The situation can be detected by traversing the topology of the _pDstVFM over to the neighboring vertex and checking if it already has a face number for the corresponding face entry on vertex. If so, then vertex and the already completed face are connected together, and the next face around vertex is examined. When the process can go no further, this method calls _activateF() on the remaining unresolved span of faces around the vertex.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.SiemensJT.Codec.MeshCodec.AddVtxToFace(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method connects vertex vertex into the topology of _pDstVFM at and around face. First, it connects vertex to face's degree ring at position iVSlot. Next, it will connect vertex into the faces at the other ends of the shared edges between vertex and the next vertices CS and CCW about face if necessary.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.SiemensJT.Codec.MeshCodec.NextActiveFace
member.summary: Returns a face from the active queue to be completed. This needn't be the one at the end of the queue, because the choice of the next active face can affect how many SPLIT symbols are produced. This method employs a fairly simple scheme of searching the most recent 16 active faces for the first one with the smallest number of incomplete slots in its degree ring.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.SiemensJT.Codec.MeshCodec.RemoveActiveFace(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes face from the active face queue.

member.summary: Searches the active face queue for face and returns its index position from the _end_ of the queue. This is needed by the ioFace() method when encoding a SPLIT symbol.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Compression.TopologySplitEventData
member.summary: Struct used for storing data about a source face that connects to an already traversed face that was either the initial face or a face encoded with either toplogy S (split) symbol. Such connection can be only caused by topology changes on the traversed surface (if its genus != 0, i.e. when the surface has topological handles or holes). For each occurence of such event we always encode the split symbol id, source symbol id and source edge id (left, or right). There will be always exectly two occurences of this event for every topological handle on the traversed mesh and one occurence for a hole.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Compression.HoleEventData
member.summary: Hole event is used to store info about the first symbol that reached a vertex of so far unvisited hole. This can happen only on either the initial face or during a regular traversal when TOPOLOGYS is encountered.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Compression.MeshPredictionScheme
member.summary: Base class for all mesh prediction schemes that use the mesh connectivity data. |MeshDataT| can be any class that provides the same interface as the PredictionSchemeMeshData class.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Compression.MeshPredictionSchemeParallelogram
member.summary: Parallelogram prediction predicts an attribute value V from three vertices on the opposite face to the predicted vertex. The values on the three vertices are used to construct a parallelogram V' = O - A - B, where O is the value on the oppoiste vertex, and A, B are values on the shared vertices: V / \ / \ / \ A-------B \ / \ / \ / O

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Compression.MeshPredictionSchemeTexCoords.orientations
member.summary: Encoded / decoded array of UV flips.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Compression.PredictionSchemeDifference
member.summary: Basic prediction scheme based on computing backward differences between stored attribute values (also known as delta-coding). Usually works better than the reference point prediction scheme, because nearby values are often encoded next to each other.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Compression.PredictionSchemeNormalOctahedronCanonicalizedTransformBase
member.summary: Base class containing shared functionality used by both encoding and decoding canonicalized normal octahedron prediction scheme transforms. See the encoding transform for more details about the method.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Compression.PredictionSchemeNormalOctahedronTransform
member.summary:
The transform works on octahedral coordinates for normals. The square is subdivided into four inner triangles (diamond) and four outer triangles. The inner trianlges are associated with the upper part of the octahedron and the outer triangles are associated with the lower part. Given a preditiction value P and the actual value Q that should be encoded, this transform first checks if P is outside the diamond. If so, the outer triangles are flipped towards the inside and vice versa. The actual correction value is then based on the mapped P and Q values. This tends to result in shorter correction vectors. This is possible since the P value is also known by the decoder, see also ComputeCorrection and ComputeOriginalValue functions. Note that the tile is not periodic, which implies that the outer edges can not be identified, which requires us to use an odd number of values on each axis. DataTypeT is expected to be some integral type.
This relates * IDF# 44535 * Patent Application: GP-200957-00-US

member.summary: Computes the corrections based on the input original values and the predicted values. The correction is always computed for all components of the input element. |valId| is the id of the input value (i.e., elementId * numComponents). The default implementation is equal to std::minus.

member.summary: Decodes any transform specific data. Called before Initialize() method.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Compression.PredictionSchemeTransform.AreCorrectionsPositive
member.summary: Should return true if all corrected values are guaranteed to be positive.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Compression.PredictionSchemeWrapTransform
member.summary: PredictionSchemeWrapTransform uses the min and max bounds of the original data to wrap stored correction values around these bounds centered at 0, i.e., when the range of the original values O is between <MIN, MAX> and N = MAX-MIN, we can then store any correction X = O - P, as: X + N, if X < -N / 2 X - N, if X > N / 2 X otherwise To unwrap this value, the decoder then simply checks whether the final corrected value F = P + X is out of the bounds of the input values. All out of bounds values are unwrapped using F + N, if F < MIN F - N, if F > MAX This wrapping can reduce the number of unique values, which translates to a better entropy of the stored values and better compression rates.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Compression.PredictionSchemeWrapTransform.ComputeCorrection(Aspose.ThreeD.Utilities.IntArray,System.Int32,Aspose.ThreeD.Utilities.IntArray,System.Int32,Aspose.ThreeD.Utilities.IntArray,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the corrections based on the input original value and the predicted value. Out of bound correction values are wrapped around the max range of input values.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Compression.PredictionSchemeWrapTransform.ComputeOriginalValue(Aspose.ThreeD.Utilities.IntArray,System.Int32,Aspose.ThreeD.Utilities.IntArray,System.Int32,Aspose.ThreeD.Utilities.IntArray,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the original value from the input predicted value and the decoded corrections. Values out of the bounds of the input values are unwrapped.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Decoder.MeshEdgeBreakerDecoderImpl
member.summary: Implementation of the edgebreaker decoder that decodes data encoded with the MeshEdgeBreakerEncoderImpl class. The implementation of the decoder is based on the algorithm presented in Isenburg et al'02 "Spirale Reversi: Reverse decoding of the Edgebreaker encoding". Note that the encoding is still based on the standard edgebreaker method as presented in "3D Compression Made Simple: Edgebreaker on a Corner-Table" by Rossignac at al.'01. http://www.cc.gatech.edu/~jarek/papers/CornerTableSMI.pdf. One difference is caused by the properties of the spirale reversi algorithm that decodes the symbols from the last one to the first one. To make the decoding more efficient, we encode all symbols in the reverse order, therefore the decoder can process them one by one. The main advantage of the spirale reversi method is that the partially decoded mesh has valid connectivity data at any time during the decoding process (valid with respect to the decoded portion of the mesh). The standard Edgebreaker decoder used two passes (forward decoding + zipping) which not only prevented us from having a valid connectivity but it was also slower. The main benefit of having the valid connectivity is that we can use the known connectivity to predict encoded symbols that can improve the compression rate.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Decoder.MeshEdgeBreakerDecoderImpl.cornerTraversalStack
member.summary: Stack used for storing corners that need to be traversed when decoding mesh vertices. New corner is added for each initial face and a split symbol, and one corner is removed when the end symbol is reached. Stored as member variable to prevent frequent memory reallocations when handling meshes with lots of disjoint components. Originally, we used recursive functions to handle this behavior, but that can cause stack memory overflow when compressing huge meshes.

member.summary: Return number of bits encoded so far.

member.summary: Class representing a buffer that can be used for either for byte-aligned encoding of arbitrary data structures or for encoding of varialble-length bit data.

member.summary: Start encoding a bit sequence. A maximum size of the sequence needs to be known upfront. If encodeSize is true, the size of encoded bit sequence is stored before the sequence. Decoder can then use this size to skip over the bit sequence if needed. Returns false on error.

member.summary: End the encoding of the bit sequence and return to the default byte-aligned encoding.

member.summary: Encode up to 32 bits into the buffer. Can be called only in between StartBitEncoding and EndBitEncoding. Otherwise returns false.

member.summary: Computes bit lengths of the input values. If numComponents > 1, the values are processed in "numComponents" sized chunks and the bit length is always computed for the largest value from the chunk.

member.summary: Class implements the edge breaker geometry compression method as described in "3D Compression Made Simple: Edgebreaker on a Corner-Table" by Rossignac at al.'01. http://www.cc.gatech.edu/~jarek/papers/CornerTableSMI.pdf

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Encoder.MeshEdgeBreakerEncoderImpl
member.summary: Class implementing the edgebreaker encoding as described in "3D Compression Made Simple: Edgebreaker on a Corner-Table" by Rossignac at al.'01. http://www.cc.gatech.edu/~jarek/papers/CornerTableSMI.pdf

member.summary: The main encoder that own's this class.

member.summary: Mesh that's being encoded.

member.summary: Corner table stores the mesh face connectivity data.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Encoder.MeshEdgeBreakerEncoderImpl.cornerTraversalStack
member.summary: Stack used for storing corners that need to be traversed when encoding the connectivity. New corner is added for each initial face and a split symbol, and one corner is removed when the end symbol is reached. Stored as member variable to prevent frequent memory reallocations when handling meshes with lots of disjoint components. Originally, we used recursive functions to handle this behavior, but that can cause stack memory overflow when compressing huge meshes.

member.summary: Array for marking visited faces.

member.summary: Array storing corners in the order they were visited during the connectivity encoding (always storing the tip corner of each newly visited face).

member.summary: This function is used to to assign correct encoding order of attributes to unprocessed corners. The encoding order is equal to the order in which the attributes are going to be processed by the decoder and it is necessary for proper prediction of attribute values. public bool AssignPositionEncodingOrderToAllCorners(); This function is used to generate encoding order for all non-position attributes. Returns false when one or more attributes failed to be processed. public bool GenerateEncodingOrderForAttributes();

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Encoder.MeshEdgeBreakerTraversalPredictiveEncoder
member.summary: Encoder that tries to predict the edgebreaker traversal symbols based on the vertex valences of the unencoded portion of the mesh. The current prediction scheme assumes that each vertex has valence 6 which can be used to predict the symbol preceeding the one that is currently encoded. Predictions are encoded using an arithmetic coding which can lead to less than 1 bit per triangle encoding for highly regular meshes.

member.summary: Explicitly count the number of encoded symbols.

member.summary: A base class for encoding attribute values of a single attribute using a given sequence of point ids. The default implementation encodes all attribute values directly to the buffer but derived classes can perform any custom encoding (such as quantization) by overriding the EncodeValues() method.

member.summary: List of attribute encoders that need to be encoded before this attribute. E.g. The parent attributes may be used to predict values used by this attribute encoder.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Encoder.SequentialAttributeEncoder.MarkParentAttribute
member.summary: Called when this attribute encoder becomes a parent encoder of another encoder.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Encoder.SequentialAttributeEncoder.PrepareLossyAttributeData

If the return value is true, the caller can call either GetLossyAttributeData() or encodedLossyAttributeData() to get a new attribute that is filled with lossy version of the original data (i.e., the same data that is going to be used by the decoder).

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Encoder.SequentialAttributeEncodersController
member.summary: A basic implementation of an attribute encoder that can be used to encode an arbitrary set of attributes. The encoder creates a sequential attribute encoder for each encoded attribute (see sequentialAttributeEncoder.h) and then it encodes all attribute values in an order defined by a point sequence generated in the GeneratePointSequence() method. The default implementation generates a linear sequence of all points, but derived classes can generate any custom sequence.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Encoder.SequentialAttributeEncodersController.CreateSequentialEncoders

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Encoder.SequentialIntegerAttributeEncoder
member.summary: Attribute encoder designed for lossless encoding of integer attributes. The attribute values can be pre-processed by a prediction scheme and compressed with a built-in entropy coder.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Encoder.SequentialIntegerAttributeEncoder.predictionScheme
member.summary: Optional prediction scheme can be used to modify the integer values in order to make them easier to compress.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Encoder.SequentialNormalAttributeEncoder
member.summary: Class for encoding normal vectors using an octahedral encoding (see Cigolle et al.'14 A Survey of Efficient Representations for Independent Unit Vectors. Compared to the basic quantization encoder, this encoder results in a better compression rate under the same accuracy settings. Note that this encoder doesn't preserve the lengths of input vectors, therefore it will not work correctly when the input values are not normalized.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.Encoder.SequentialQuantizationAttributeEncoder
member.summary: Attribute encoder that quantizes floating point attribute values. The quantized values can be optionally compressed using an entropy coding.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.CornerTableTraversalProcessor`1
member.summary: Class providing the basic traversal funcionality needed by traversers (such as the EdgeBreakerTraverser, see edgebreakerTraverser.h). It is used to return the corner table that is used for the traversal, plus it provides a basic book-keeping of visited faces and vertices during the traversal.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.LinearSequencer
member.summary: A simple sequencer that generates a linear sequence [0, numPoints - 1]. I.e., the order of the points is preserved for the input data.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.MeshAttributeIndicesEncodingData
member.summary: Data used for encoding and decoding of mesh attributes.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.MeshAttributeIndicesEncodingData.encodedAttributeValueIndexToCornerMap
member.summary: Array for storing the corner ids in the order their associated attribute entries were encoded/decoded. For every encoded attrbiute value entry we store exactly one corner. I.e., this is the mapping between an encoded attribute entry ids and corner ids. This map is needed for example by prediction schemes. Note that not all corners are included in this map, e.g., if multiple corners share the same attribute value, only one of these corners will be usually included.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.MeshAttributeIndicesEncodingData.vertexToEncodedAttributeValueIndexMap
member.summary: Map for storing encoding order of attribute entries for each vertex. i.e. Mapping between vertices and their corresponding attribute entry ids that are going to be used by the decoder. -1 if an attribute entry hasn't been encoded/decoded yet.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.MeshAttributeIndicesEncodingData.numValues
member.summary: Total number of encoded/decoded attribute entries.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.MeshTraversalSequencer`1.SetCornerOrder(Aspose.ThreeD.Utilities.IntList)
member.summary: Function that can be used to set an order in which the mesh corners should be processed. This is an optional flag used usually only by the encoder to match the same corner order that is going to be used by the decoder. Note that |cornerOrder| should contain only one corner per face (it can have all corners but only the first encountered corner for each face is going to be used to start a traversal). If the corner order is not set, the corners are processed sequentially based on their ids.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.PointsSequencer

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.CornerTable
member.summary:
CornerTable is used to represent connectivity of triangular meshes. For every corner of all faces, the corner table stores the index of the opposite corner in the neighboring face (if it exists) as illustrated in the figure below (see corner |c| and it's opposite corner |o|).
* /c\ / \ /n p\ *-------* \ / \ / \o/ *
All corners are defined by unique CornerIndex and each triplet of corners that define a single face id always ordered consecutively as: { 3 * FaceIndex, 3 * FaceIndex + 1, 3 * FaceIndex +2 }. This representation of corners allows CornerTable to easily retrieve Next and Previous corners on any face (see corners |n| and |p| in the figure above). Using the Next, Previous, and Opposite corners then enables traversal of any 2-manifold surface. If the CornerTable is constructed from a non-manifold surface, the input non-manifold edges and vertices are automatically split.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.CornerTable.SwingRight(System.Int32)
member.summary: *-------* / \ / \ / \ / \ / sl\c/sr \ *-------v-------* Returns the corner on the adjacent face on the right that maps to the same vertex as the given corner (sr in the above diagram).

member.summary: Returns the number of new vertices that were created as a result of spliting of non-manifold vertices of the input geometry.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.CornerTable.NumDegeneratedFaces
member.summary: Returns the number of faces with duplicated vertex indices.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.CornerTable.NumIsolatedVertices
member.summary: Returns the number of isolated vertices (vertices that have vertexCorners mapping set to kInvalidCornerIndex.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.CornerTable.SwingLeft(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the corner on the left face that maps to the same vertex as the given corner (sl in the above diagram).

*-------*-------* \L /X\ R/ \ / \ / \ / \ / *-------*

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.GeometryAttribute
member.summary: The class provides access to a specific attribute which is stored in a DataBuffer, such as normals or coordinates. However, the GeometryAttribute class does not own the buffer and the buffer itself may store other data unrelated to this attribute (such as data for other attributes in which case we can have multiple GeometryAttributes accessing one buffer). Typically, all attributes for a point (or corner, face) are stored in one block, which is advantageous in terms of memory access. The length of the entire block is given by the byteStride, the position where the attribute starts is given by the byteOffset, the actual number of bytes that the attribute occupies is given by the dataType and the number of components.

members.member: User defined 16-bit id that can be for example used to identify generic attributes. By default |customId| == 0.

A left most corner is a corner that is adjecent to a boundary or an attribute seam from right (i.e., SwingLeft from that corner will return an invalid corner). If no such corner exists for a given vertex, then any corner attached to the vertex can be used.

member.summary: Creates and adds a new attribute to the point cloud. The attribute has properties derived from the provided GeometryAttribute |att|. If |identityMapping| is set to true, the attribute will use identity mapping between point indices and attribute value indices (i.e., each point has a unique attribute value). If |identityMapping| is false, the mapping between point indices and attribute value indices is set to explicit, and it needs to be initialized manually using the PointAttribute::SetPointMapEntry() method. |numAttributeValues| can be used to specify the number of attribute values that are going to be stored in the newly created attribute. Returns attribute id of the newly created attribute.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Draco.EdgeBreakerTopologyBitPattern
member.summary:
A variable length encoding for storing all possible topology configurations during traversal of mesh's surface. The configurations are based on visited state of neighboring triangles around a currently processed face corner. Note that about half of the encountered configurations is expected to be of type TOPOLOGYC. It's guaranteed that the encoding will use at most 2 bits per triangle for meshes with no holes and up to 6 bits per triangle for general meshes. In addition, the encoding will take up to 4 bits per triangle for each non-position attribute attached to the mesh.
*-------* *-------* *-------* / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ *-------v-------* *-------v-------* *-------v-------* \ /x\ / /x\ / \ /x\ \ / \ / / \ / \ / \ \ / C \ / / L \ / \ / R \ *-------* *-------* *-------*
* * / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ / \ *-------v-------* v \ /x\ / /x\ \ / \ / / \ \ / S \ / / E \ *-------* *-------*

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode
member.summary: Render mode specifies the style in which the 3D artwork is rendered.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.Solid
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.SolidWireframe
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes (triangles) with single color edges on top of them.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.Transparent
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes (triangles) with an added level of transparency.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.TransparentWireframe
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes (triangles) with an added level of transparency, with single color opaque edges on top of it.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.BoundingBox
member.summary: Displays the bounding box edges of each node, aligned with the axes of the local coordinate space for that node.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.TransparentBoundingBox
member.summary: Displays bounding boxes faces of each node, aligned with the axes of the local coordinate space for that node, with an added level of transparency.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.TransparentBoundingBoxOutline
member.summary: Displays bounding boxes edges and faces of each node, aligned with the axes of the local coordinate space for that node, with an added level of transparency.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.Wireframe
member.summary: Displays only edges in a single color.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.ShadedWireframe
member.summary: Displays only edges, though interpolates their color between their two vertices and applies lighting.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.HiddenWireframe
member.summary: Displays edges in a single color, though removes back-facing and obscured edges.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.Vertices
member.summary: Displays only vertices in a single color.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.ShadedVertices
member.summary: Displays only vertices, though uses their vertex color and applies lighting.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.Illustration
member.summary: Displays silhouette edges with surfaces, removes obscured lines.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.SolidOutline
member.summary: Displays silhouette edges with lit and textured surfaces, removes obscured lines.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.PdfRenderMode.ShadedIllustration
member.summary: Displays silhouette edges with lit and textured surfaces and an additional emissive term to remove poorly lit areas of the artwork.

members.member: The number of texture layers used by this material
This array gives the dimensions of the texture coordinates used for each texture layer in the material. Texture coordinates can range from 1-dimensional to 4-dimensional.
If the array of IFXAuthorMaterials gets smaller because the scrubber removed unused materials and repacked them, this field gives the original array index of the material record.
True if this material specifies diffuse vertex colors.
True if this material specifies specular vertex colors.
Set to TRUE if any of the faces in this material use normals, FALSE if no faces use normals.
