member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Discreet3DSSaveOptions.DuplicatedNameSeparator
member.summary:
The separator between object's name and the duplicated counter, default value is "_".
When scene contains objects that use the same name, Aspose.3D 3DS exporter will generate a different name for the object. For example there's two nodes named "Box", the first node will have a name "Box", and the second node will get a new name "Box_2" using the default configuration.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Discreet3DSSaveOptions.DuplicatedNameCounterBase
member.summary: The counter used by generating new name for duplicated names, default value is 2.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Discreet3DSSaveOptions.DuplicatedNameCounterFormat
member.summary: The format of the duplicated counter, default value is empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Discreet3DSSaveOptions.MasterScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the master scale used in exporting.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Discreet3DSSaveOptions.GammaCorrectedColor
member.summary: A 3ds file may contains original color and gamma corrected color for same attribute, Setting this to true will use the gamma corrected color if possible, otherwise the Aspose.3D will try to use the original color.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Discreet3DSSaveOptions.FlipCoordinateSystem
member.summary: Gets or sets flip coordinate system of control points/normal during importing/exporting.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Formats.Discreet3DSSaveOptions.HighPreciseColor
member.summary: If this is true, the generated 3ds file will use high precise color, means each channel of red/green/blue are in 32bit float. Otherwise the generated file will use 24bit color, each channel use 8bit byte. The default value is false, because not all applications supports the high-precise color.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Constraints.Constraint
member.summary: Base class for weighted animation constraints. Constraints are primarily used to impose limits on properties of objects (e.g. position, orientation, scale) and to automate animation processes. A constrained object is an object with properties constrained by one or more weighted constraint sources.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Constraints.Constraint.Weight
member.summary: This property represents the degree of influence of a constraint from 0.0 (no influence) to 100.0 (full influence).

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Constraints.Constraint.Active
member.summary: This property controls whether the constraint is applied or not.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Constraints.Constraint.Lock
member.summary: This property handles the lock state of the constraint.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Constraints.Constraint.Sources
member.summary: This property handles constraint source objects.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.Constraints.Constraint.Target
member.summary: This property handles constraint target objects.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Add a source to the constraint.

member.summary: Add a source to the constraint.
member.param: The weight of the source object

member.summary: Return the weight for given source object, or -1 if object is not defined in this constraint

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Constraints.ConstraintParent
member.summary: The parent constraint creates a parent-to-child relationship between any two objects, from any two hierarchies. It creates the same relationship as the parent-to-child relationships found in hierarchies. You can use this constraint to connect objects without changing hierarchies.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Constraints.CharacterConstraint
member.summary: A Character is a person or animal with pre-defined skeleton system. The skeleton system is composed of multiple named node (skeleton). This class contains all methods to setup an exported character or query information on an imported character. This class also contains some methods for manipulating the CharacterLink, ControlSet. The most important part of a Character is the CharacterLink. There is one CharacterLink for each characterized node. For more information see CharacterLink class documentation.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Deformers.Bone
member.summary: A bone defines the subset of the geometry's control point, and defined blend weight for each control point. The object cannot be used directly, a instance is used to deform the geometry, and comes with a set of bones, each bone linked to a node. NOTE: A control point of a geometry can be bounded to more than one Bones.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Deformers.MorphTargetDeformer
member.summary: MorphTargetDeformer provides per-vertex animation. MorphTargetDeformer organize all targets via , each channel can organize multiple targets. A common use of morph target deformer is to apply facial expression to a character. More details can be found at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morph_target_animation

The messages are defined in Resources/ErrorMessages.txt The build will automatically convert it to Resource/ErrorMessages.bin
lex.chou@aspose.com designed this simple encryption algorithm, and it's encryption can be found in ReleaseTools/MessageEncryptor.cs

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:

ms.p: 2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

java.p: 2. The folder that contains the Aspose component JAR file.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling JAR file.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")
the component jar file:
License license = new License(); license.setLicense("MyLicense.lic");
Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.value: true if product is licensed; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.LicenseCore
member.summary: The actual code of the license class is put into an internal class and made into long functions to make it harder for the crackers to find anything meaningful after the dlls were cracked in November 2005.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.LicenseCore.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.LicenseCore.SetLicenseCore(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Note, this function was manually tuned (made complex) so it does not decompile in Reflector.
member.param: The stream to load license from.
member.returns: Error code when license setting failed. 0 on success.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.LicenseCore.GetLicenseState
member.summary: Call this from your component code to check if running evaluation version or not.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.LicenseCore.CheckEdition(Aspose.ThreeD.EditionType,System.String)
member.summary:
Note, this function was manually tuned (made complex) so it does not decompile in Reflector.
Call this when the user attempts to use a feature that is limited by edition type. Throws a message explaining the license limitation to the user.
member.remarks: Most of Aspose products are supposed to have just one edition type. Only complex products might have two edition types. When using two edition types, make sure it is easy for the client to select edition type they need.
member.param: Specify edition type that is required to access your feature.
Message that explains what feature the user is trying to access.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.LicenseCore.Products
member.summary: Gets Aspose product names this license is for. You need to specify value that matches the value specified in AssemblyProduct attribute. This is used to check that the license is suitable for this product.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.LicenseCore.EditionType
member.summary: Gets edition type. You can use this to enable/disable some features depending on the edition type.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.LicenseCore.SerialNumber
member.summary: Unique license number. Used to black list stolen licenses.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.LicenseCore.SubscriptionExpiry
member.summary: Gets the last date of the subscription. This is to be checked against custom attribute on the assembly that contains the relase date.

member.name: P:Aspose.ThreeD.LicenseCore.LicenseExpiry
member.summary: This is for temporary licenses.

member.summary:
Verifies the signature on the XML file and loads it into the license files, but does not check them. Made internal only for unit testing, do not call directly otherwise.
Note, this function was manually tuned (made complex) so it does not decompile in Reflector.

member.summary: Gets the product venture.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.LicenseCore.LoadLicense(System.String)
member.summary: See above. Use for unit testing only.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.LicenseCore.VerifySignature(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Xml.XmlNode,Aspose.License.Hackers.RsaSignatureVerifier)
member.summary:
Verifies that content of the data element has not been tampered with. Safe to pass nulls.
Note there is no direct action taken inside this method if the signature is invalid. If the signature is invalid, the VerificationSupervisor.SignatureInvalidFlag is set to greater than zero and you need to examine it somewhere later in your code. This is to confuse hackers.

member.name: M:Aspose.ThreeD.LicenseCore.ProbeLicense(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Tries to find the license in several locations: 1. Explicit path. 2. The folder of this assembly. 3. The folder of the client's calling assembly. 4. The folder of the entry assembly (does not apply for the .NET Compact Framework). 5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
member.param: This can be full or short file name or name of an embedded resource.
Client's calling assembly. Used to find license in embedded resource.
member.returns: Returns a stream that contains the license or throws.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.VentureLicenser
member.summary:
This class is invoked by the GroupDocs.Product to license/watermak an Aspose.Product document instance.
The calling must be done in a "secure" way so it is harder for hackers to find how GroupDocs uses Aspose without a license. To make the calling "secure" the class is internal so its name will be obfuscated, but it has a unique combination of default parameter values in its special constructor so GroupDocs can find it.
This type has to be a struct, not a class. There is a situation where AppDomain sometimes cannot invoke internal members via reflection. We overcome this by creating default structure instances, it is somewhat a security hole in .NET. Related info https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/stfy7tfc(v=vs.110).aspx

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Node
member.summary: Represents an element in the scene graph. A scene graph is a tree of Node objects. The tree management services are self contained in this class. Note the Aspose.3D SDK does not test the validity of the constructed scene graph. It is the responsibility of the caller to make sure that it does not generate cyclic graphs in a node hierarchy. Besides the tree management, this class defines all the properties required to describe the position of the object in the scene. This information include the basic Translation, Rotation and Scaling properties and the more advanced options for pivots, limits, and IK joints attributes such the stiffness and dampening. When it is first created, the Node object is "empty" (i.e: it is an object without any graphical representation that only contains the position information). In this state, it can be used to represent parents in the node tree structure but not much more. The normal use of this type of objects is to add them an entity that will specialize the node (see the "Entity"). The entity is an object in itself and is connected to the the Node. This also means that the same entity can be shared among multiple nodes. Camera, Light, Mesh, etc... are all entities and they all derived from the base class Entity.

member.summary: A scene is a top-level object that contains the nodes, geometries, materials, textures, animation, poses, sub-scenes and etcs. Scene can have sub-scenes, acts as multiple-document support in files like collada/blender/fbx Node hierarchy can be accessed through is used to keep a reference of unattached objects during serialization(like meta data or custom objects) so it can be used as a library.

member.summary: Gets or sets the transparency factor. The factor should be ranged between 0(0%, fully opaque) and 1(100%, fully transparent) Any invalid factor value will be clampped.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode
member.summary: Layered blend mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Translucent
member.summary: The new texture layer is transparent (depending on the Alpha value).

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Additive
member.summary: Add the color of the new texture to the previous texture.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Modulate
member.summary: Multiples the color value of the new texture by the color values of all previous layers of texture.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Modulate2
member.summary: Multiples the color value of the new texture by two and then by the color values of all previous layers of texture.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Over
member.summary: Equivalent to Translucent. Blends the new texture over top of the old texture, according to the new texture's alpha channel.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Normal
member.summary: The colors of the two layers will not interact in any way, and it will display the full value of the colors in layer 1.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Dissolve
member.summary: Dissolve makes the lower layer take on the colors of the top layer, and how much depends on the opacity of the upper layer.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Darken
member.summary: Darken compares each pixel value of the upper layer to its counterpart's pixel value of the lower layer and chooses the darker of the two to display.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary: Color Burn burns in the color of the upper layer with the lower layer. No part of the image will get lighter.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.LinearBurn
member.summary: Linear Burn works like multiply but the results are more intense.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.DarkerColor
member.summary: This blend mode simply divides pixel values of one layer with the other.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Lighten
member.summary: Lighten compares the two layers pixel for pixel and uses the lightest pixel value. No part of the image gets darker.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Screen
member.summary: Screen brightens by lightning the lower layer based on the lightness of the upper layer

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary: Color Dodge dodges the lower layer with the upper layer, resulting in a lighter image. No part of the image will be darkened.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.LinearDodge
member.summary: Linear Dodge works like screen but with more intense results.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.LighterColor
member.summary: This blend mode has the opposite effect of the Darker Color mode. It compares all the values in both layers, then displays the lightest values.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary: Soft Light will multiply the dark tones and screen the light tones.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.HardLight
member.summary: Hard Light multiplies the dark colors and screens the light colors.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.VividLight
member.summary: Vivid Light will dodges or burn the lower layer pixels depending on whether the upper layer pixels are brighter or darker than neutral gray. It works on the contrast of the lower layer.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.LinearLight
member.summary: Linear Light is the same as Vivid light but it works on the brightness of the lower layer.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.PinLight
member.summary: Pin Light changes the lower layer pixels depending on how bright the pixels are in the upper layer.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.HardMix
member.summary: Produces either white or black, depending on similarities between A and B.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Difference
member.summary: Difference reacts to the differences between the upper and lower layer pixels.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Exclusion uses the darkness of the lower layer to mask the difference between upper and lower layers.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Subtract
member.summary: The result color is the foreground color subtracted from the background color. The result color is then applied over the background color using the foreground alpha to define the opacity of the result.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Divide
member.summary: This blend mode simply divides pixel values of one layer with the other.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Hue changes the hue of the lower layer to the hue of the upper layer but leaves brightness and saturation alone.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Saturation
member.summary: Saturation changes the saturation of the lower layer to the hue of the upper layer but leaves brightness and hue alone.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Color
member.summary: Color changes the hue and saturation of the lower layer to the hue and saturation of the upper layer but leaves luminosity alone.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Luminosity
member.summary: Luminosity changes the luminosity of the lower layer to the luminosity of the upper layer while leaving hue and saturation the same.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredBlendMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies (darkens) when the layer on which the mode is set is dark and screens (brightens) when the layer on which the mode is applied is lighter.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.LayeredTexture
member.summary: LayeredTexture is a combination of multiple textures(Texture) blended sequentially.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.WrapMode
member.summary: Texture's wrap mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.WrapMode.Wrap
member.summary: Tiles the texture on the model's surface, creating a repeating pattern.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.WrapMode.Clamp
member.summary: Clamps the texture to the last pixel at the border.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.WrapMode.Mirror
member.summary: The texture will be repeated, but it will be mirrored when the integer part of the coordinate is odd.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.WrapMode.MirrorOnce
member.summary: The texture will be mirrored once, and then clamps to the maximum value.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.WrapMode.Border
member.summary: The coordinates that outside of the range [0.0, 1.0] are set to a specified border color.

member.summary: Defines whether the texture contains the alpha channel.

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.AlphaSource.PixelAlpha
member.summary: The alpha is defined by pixel's alpha channel

member.name: F:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.AlphaSource.FixedValue
member.summary: The Alpha is a fixed value which is defined by

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.Shading.ShaderMaterial
member.summary: A shader material allows to describe the material by external rendering engine or shader language. uses to describe the concrete rendering details, and the most suitable one will be used according to the final rendering platform. For example, your instance can have two technique, one is defined by HLSL, and another is defined by GLSL Under non-window platform the GLSL should be used instead of HLSL

member.name: T:Aspose.ThreeD.TimeMode
member.summary: Time mode.
member.remarks: NTSCDropFrame is used for broadcasting operations where clock time must be (almost) in sync with time code. To bring back color NTSC time code with clock time, this mode drops 2 frames per minute except for every 10 minutes (00, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50). 108 frames are dropped per hour. Over 24 hours the error is 2 frames and 1/4 of a frame. A time-code of 01:00:03:18 equals a clock time of 01:00:00:00 NTSCFullFrame represents a time address and therefore is NOT IN SYNC with clock time. A time code of 01:00:00:00 equals a clock time of 01:00:03:18.

member.name: T:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor
member.summary:
Contains flags set by the meaningful comparer methods. This is necessary to ensure that crackers have not cut out the entry point of the verification algorithm located in LicenseCore.VerifySignature() and all the methods have been called. The flags should be set by 3 comparer methods subsequently, each method must check if the previous method has been invoked.
Also see SignatureInvalidFlag in this class.

member.name: M:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.Clear
member.summary: Made accessible so license unit tests can reset the static state properly.

member.name: M:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.EnsureIfAllMethodsInvoked
member.summary: Returns 0x100 if all methods have been invoked properly, returns 0x1000 otherwise.
